head.title: Arts, Briefly; 'Rock Star' Gets a Boost

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Media, Entertainment and Publishing

hedline.hl1: Arts, Briefly; 'Rock Star' Gets a Boost

body.head.byline: By KATE AURTHUR; Compiled by Lawrence Van Gelder

abstract.p: Arts, Briefly column; CBS, for second consecutive night, wins overnight Nielsen ratings (S)

block.p: For the second night in a row, CBS won both in total viewers and among 18-to-49-year-olds in Nielsen's estimates. Its Tuesday night military crime show, ''NCIS,'' continued to do well in summer repeats, drawing 8.73 million viewers. Following that, ''Big Brother'' brought in a slightly smaller audience (8.37 million), but scored higher than ''NCIS'' in the 18-to-49 demographic. Those strong numbers bolstered the languid ''Rock Star: INXS'' at 10 p.m. The episode of ''Rock Star,'' in which the contestants performed, was No. 2 in its hour with 6.28 million viewers, but it took first place among adults 18 to 49. Its main competition was NBC's ''Law & Order: Special Victims Unit'' rerun (7.56 million), which lifted NBC into second place for the night in households. Also at 10 p.m., the ABC miniseries ''Empire'' came to a conclusion, but only 4.33 million viewers know what that conclusion was.

For the second night in a row, CBS won both in total viewers and among 18-to-49-year-olds in Nielsen's estimates. Its Tuesday night military crime show, ''NCIS,'' continued to do well in summer repeats, drawing 8.73 million viewers. Following that, ''Big Brother'' brought in a slightly smaller audience (8.37 million), but scored higher than ''NCIS'' in the 18-to-49 demographic. Those strong numbers bolstered the languid ''Rock Star: INXS'' at 10 p.m. The episode of ''Rock Star,'' in which the contestants performed, was No. 2 in its hour with 6.28 million viewers, but it took first place among adults 18 to 49. Its main competition was NBC's ''Law & Order: Special Victims Unit'' rerun (7.56 million), which lifted NBC into second place for the night in households. Also at 10 p.m., the ABC miniseries ''Empire'' came to a conclusion, but only 4.33 million viewers know what that conclusion was.
